resources: Rolling Stones Trivia True False Settings Correct! Incorrect! Next! Keith Richards named his favorite guitar Micawber. // true Exile on Main Street was recorded in England. // false Most of the iconic Keith Richards guitar riffs were written on six strings. // false Micawber is a Fender Telecaster. //true The song "Bittersweet Symphony" was written by the Rolling Stones. // true The Rolling Stones first album was originally named the Rolling Stones and subsequently named England\'s newest hitmakers. // true Of the twelve songs on Englands Newest Hit Makers, only one was written by Jagger / Richards. // true Exile on Main Street originally received mixed reviews. // true At the time of the recording of Exile on Main Street, neither Keith or Mick were married. // false The bands performance at the Altamont Free Concert proceeded without incident. // false Brown Sugar was recorded at Alabama\'s Muscle Shoals studio. // true (I can\'t get no) Satisfaction was the bands first US/international number one hit. // true Nanker Phelge was an original songrwriting pen name the band used for songs written by Jagger / Richards . // false Start Me Up is written in standard open E tuning. // false Jagger and Richards attended Wentworth Primary School in England together. // true Richards wrote the riff for Satisfaction in the middle of the day. // false Brian Jones was a founding member of the band . // true Keith Richards did not like to record when the band was on the road. // false Wild Horses was recorded in England. // false Much of the material for Exile on Main Street was written and recorded in a French Villa called Nellcote. // true The cover of You Gotta Move on Sticky Fingers was recorded in England as the stones didn\'t want it to sound too bluesy. // false Are you sure you want to do this? Show Answer Cheat! Cheating is wrong Cheat Hello world!
